title: 123 go
body: {"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Find the number of intersection of diagonals in a 123-sided regular polygon."}]},{"type":"text","text":"\n\n"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Clarification","marks":[{"type":"bold"}]},{"type":"text","text":": if 2 intersections coincide with each other then both of                   them are to be considered."}]}]}

title: 1, 2, 3, Go!
body: {"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" f(x) = \\dfrac{(x-1)(x-3)}{(x-2)^2} "}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]},{"type":"text","text":"\n\n"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Considering the function above, what is the intersection point of the graph's asymptotes?"}]}]}

discussion.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" f(x) = \dfrac{(x-1)(x-3)}{(x-2)^2} = \dfrac{x^2 - 4x +3}{x^2 - 4x +4} = 1 - \dfrac{1}{x^2 - 4x +4}"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"image","attrs":{"src":"/brilliantexport/brioche/uploads/GPjoGjUPsq-point-of-asymptotes.JPG?width=1200"}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"From the graph above, this function (red) is hyperbolic with "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"x = 2"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" (blue) as its vertical asymptote, for "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"x"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" can't equal to 2. "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Also, if "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"y"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" = "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"f(x)"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" = 1, then 0 = - "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\dfrac{1}{x^2 - 4x +4}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Then "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"f(x)"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" can only approach "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"y = 1"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" once "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"x"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" reaches +/- infinity. Therefore, "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"y = 1"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" (green) is the graph's horizontal asymptote."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Hence, these two asymptotes will intersect each other at the coordinates "},{"type":"text","text":"(2 , 1)","marks":[{"type":"bold"}]},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

title: Power loss in conductors
body: {"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Whatâ€™s the conductor power loss in watts for a 10AWG conductor that has a voltage drop of 3 percent in a 240V circuit, and carries a current flow of 24A?"}]}]}

discussion.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"I=24A"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"E=240V x 3%"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"E=240V x 0.03"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"E= 7.20V"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"The formula is P= I x E"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"24A x 7.20V = 172.80W"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}
